newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Banca de Gottardo with steady 1996 profit.
newsitem.headline: Banca de Gottardo with steady 1996 profit.

text.p: Banca de Gottardo, majority-owned by Japan's Sumitomo Bank, said its 1996 net profit was steady at 53 million Swiss francs and it would propose paying out an unchanged dividend of 25 percent, or 25 francs per share.
However, to celebrate the bank's 40th anniversary, Banca del Gottardo said it also would propose to shareholders on April 30 that an extraordinary dividend of three percent be distributed.
While 1996 was a favourable year for financial markets, the bank said Switzerland's economic situation was disappointing.
The potential risk of loan losses made Banca del Gottardo increase general provisions to 133.4 million francs, of which 55 million was extraordinary income from previous provisions.
In 1995 Banca del Gottardo set aside 69 million francs for write-offs and loan-loss provisions.
The operating gross profit improved due to lower costs to 153 million francs from 130.9 million.
Total assets rose 4.4 percent to 8.87 billion francs.
